result.execSummary:
The defendant Waldo Medina-Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 3 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at zero. Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Court ordered cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining bail on deposit to be returned to poster.
Maintain employment of at least 30 hours per week.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.   Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
No contact with the victim or any Class B licensed tavern.

Absolutely no driving for 6 months.
Anger management classes.
Attend a cognitive thinking program.

AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED BUT STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent. Release privileges to be determined at the discretion of the agent. Defendant to serve 14 days of the condition time FORTHWITH. During the 14 days, the defendant may have release for school upon providing proof to the House of Correction and may participate in programming at the House.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Waldo Medina-Guzman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Waldo Medina-Guzman in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel is requesting additional time for the defendant to complete programming prior to the sentencing date. State does not object to an adjournment and does not have a victim present in court for the sentencing today.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed:
Ineligible  Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties request a separate date for sentencing.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothtsein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justicer Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and adjourned case for sentencing in Branch 25 on 8/20/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Waldo Medina-Guzman in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 01:  
Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, a Class G Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 941.30(2) and 939.63(1)(b).
Crime Victim Impact Statement, filed.

Defendant Waldo Medina-Guzman in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink who appeared by telephone.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.   New date selected.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Waldo Medina-Guzman in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared on behalf of James C. Griffin  for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  ADA Griffin contacted to obtain mutally agreeable date.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Waldo Medina-Guzman in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Entry made without file.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All terms of bail remain.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Defendant Waldo Medina-Guzman in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Ronald Dague on behalf of James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Amanda C., Jynx- 715 S 5th St., Milwaukee (including ALL employees, grounds, parking lots and adjacent streets or alleys).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Waldo Medina-Guzman in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
